item.title: Tree branches too close to Upper street property, 22nd September
item.description:
The tree outside 326 Upper street is very close to the property, so much so that it caused some brickwork to become dislodged, possibly from 326 and adjacent properties, during the storm on 15th Sept 2025. The fire brigade was called and cut back some branches but this needs to be assessed as a matter of priority, as the falling bricks could have caused serious harm. The tree is still hitting off the building, and could cause damage and injury going forward.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 330, Upper Street, Islington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Width restriction Slade green rd, 22nd September
item.description:
When are posts going back. Unacceptable noise from huge Lorrie’s thundering along rd and skip Lorries spilling their rubbish, nails metal etc on rd. This has been going on for too long now. Noise starts at 5.30 in morning. Please reinstate the posts and stop heavy traffic passing through width restriction. Also a danger to school children from school .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Slade Green Road, Slade Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside Alleyns school in Regent’s Park ( Road barriers), 22nd September
item.description:
I fell backwards while leaning on the barrier as it backs into my sons school. This is extremely heavy rail and it’s hanging on by a thread. Soon it will fall onto a child and it could be deadly. This is unacceptable as this is meant to be for protecting pedestrians on the pavement. It’s hanging together by 1 screw and a rope. This is unacceptable.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Avenue, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet
